alert.note: Alert for Coastal Franklin; Coastal Wakulla; Inland Franklin; Inland Gulf; Inland Wakulla; Liberty (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 11:43PM EDT by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Gulf, southwestern Wakulla, southeastern Liberty and Franklin Counties through 1215 AM EDT/1115 PM CDT/... At 1143 PM EDT/1043 PM CDT/, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 13 miles south of Crawfordville to 20 miles northeast of Eastpoint to 7 miles west of Carrabelle. Movement was northwest at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Carrabelle, Eastpoint, Franklin, Sopchoppy, Carrabelle Beach, East Camp, Jewel Fire Tower, Royal Bluff, St George Island St Pk, Beverly, Panacea, Poplar Camp, Smith Creek, Medart, Buckhorn, Twin Pole, Curtis Mill, Hays Place, Fort Gadsden and Alligator Point. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Coastal Franklin; Coastal Wakulla; Inland Franklin; Inland Gulf; Inland Wakulla; Liberty
